article: Lisa Reid lost her sight because of cancer ten years ago, but a knock on the head has given it back. The 24-year-old lady has  _  part of her sight after being knocked on the head. Eleven days ago, Miss Reid  _  down to kiss her guide dog good night, but accidentally hit her head on a coffee table.  _  she woke up the next morning, she could see for the first time in 10 years. "I could  _  believe it. It's amazing," she said. The cancer that stole Miss Reid's sight was diagnosed 13 years ago. Doctors gave her a five percent  _  of survival after discovering she had brain cancer. An operation to excide the tumor was  _  , but it damaged her eyes and had a bad effect  _  her sight. Miss Reid was blind at 14, and her eyes were only able to notice  _  and dark.. "I had lost hope and thought that everything was against me," she said. Now Miss Reid has recovered 80 percent of the sight in her left eye, but her color vision is  _  . The eye expert has no  _  for her recovery because he has never seen a similar case . After Miss Reid recovered her sight on November 17, she  _  it a secret at the beginning, but later in the day she called her  _  and over the telephone read the health warning on a cigarette package to her mum. "Lisa  _  me and said'there's been a change; listen to this'," said Louise Reid, Miss Reid's mother. "Then she started reading to me. I was surprised." Unsure whether her sight would last , Miss Reid waited  _  the next day before  throwing away  her walking stick and spreading the good news. She couldn't wait to celebrate it with her family and friends.
